Noldo]] of the [[First Age]]: [ˈa͡ɛɡnor]}}) was a son of [[Finarfin]] and a lord of the [[Noldor]]. He was terrible in battle, seemingly having a fire in his eyes<ref>{{PM
film character also called "Aegnor": Shibboleth}}</ref>, and his golden hair was stiff and straight. Even at a young age this was noticeable, though he was also known to be a very generous and noble spirit.

Noldo]] of the [[First Age]]: Feanor}}</ref> He had a strong friendship with [[Fingon]] and grace to him, and he followed the Exiles under the host of [[Fingolfin]] with his brother Angrod.<ref>{{S

{{disambig-two: He settled with his brother on the northern slopes of [[Dorthonion]],<ref>{{S

It is said that because of her sake, he would not take any Elven bride.<ref name="Athrabeth">{{MR

{{disambig-two: Together with Angrod he held the highlands of [[Dorthonion]] against [[Morgoth]]. Aegnor and Angrod were both slain in the [[Dagor Bragollach]] by the flames from [[Thangorodrim]].<ref>{{S
